title: Shoppers Are Ready to 'Go Crazy' Over Trader Joe's ' ...

article.title: Shoppers Are Ready to 'Go Crazy' Over Trader Joe's ' ...
article.description:
Yasmine Coleman

November 12, 2025 at 11:37 AM

0

- Copied

(Photo by Kevin Carter/Getty Images)

Trader Joe's has a brand-new treat in stores, and shoppers who've spotted it are already highlighting the find on social media.

In a new Instagram post shared on Tuesday, Nov. 11, food account [@traderjoeshungry introduced the tasty new frozen treat](https://www.instagram.com/p/DQ7J659j61r/?img_index=1) in a roundup of other new additions: Gingerbread Ice Cream Sandwiches.

While minimal information was given on the grocery store find, based on the product's packaging, the dessert option comes in a dark green box with adorable images of gingerbread man-shaped ice cream sandwiches sprawled across the front.

**Related: [Dr Pepper's Yummy New Release Is Bound to Become a Holiday Favorite](https://parade.com/food/dr-pepper-yummy-new-release-bound-to-become-holiday-favorite)**

The 4-count seasonal offering retails for $3.99, and is described as "gingerbread cookies with vanilla bean ice cream," with each sweet treat coming in at 170 calories per serving.

A separate Instagram account added more details on the delectable in a following post, writing, "Adorable. Delicious. Dangerous. They taste like Christmas met a cozy cookie jar and decided to chill. Literally."

They even included some "pro tips" for those who plan to try them: "🎅 Let them sit out for 2–3 minutes for that perfect chewy-cookie texture. 🍨 Crumble one into a mug, drizzle caramel or hot fudge, and thank me later.✨ sandwich hack: roll the edges in crushed candy canes or the new Vanilla Sugar for a festive crunch."

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DQ7SvEbkn1i/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Excitement filled the comments sections of the two social media updates.

"Omg stahhhhppppppppp," one wrote, prompting a direct response from the original poster: "I knoooooo 😍😍."

Someone else admitted the treats were already "calling my nameeeee🙌."
